## Netgrep.search() method

Search a remote file for a specific pattern. This method uses `ripgrep` under the hood in order to start searching while downloading the file instead of waiting for the whole file to be available offline.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
search<T extends object>(url: string, pattern: string, metadata?: T, config?: NetgrepSearchConfig): Promise<NetgrepResult<T>>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  url | string | The url to the remote file. |
|  pattern | string | The pattern to search for. This can be anything <code>ripgrep</code> can understand. |
|  metadata | T | <i>(Optional)</i> An optional object that will be returned back as soon as a match as been found in the file. |
|  config | [NetgrepSearchConfig](./netgrep.netgrepsearchconfig.md) | <i>(Optional)</i> An optional configuration respecting the <code>NetgrepSearchConfig</code> type. |

<b>Returns:</b>

Promise&lt;[NetgrepResult](./netgrep.netgrepresult.md)<!-- -->&lt;T&gt;&gt;

- A promise resolving to a `NetgrepResult<T>` as soon as a match will be found in the remote file.
